components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description: In EUCA-12423 we added {{KillMode=process}} to eucanetd.service to ensure that the nginx and dhcpd processes eucanetd spawns stick around across service restarts.  If we need them to have independent lifecycles we should define them as separate services and have eucanetd just start the services instead so we don't have to deal with unintentionally stray processes later.
fields.summary: eucanetd-spawned dhcpd and nginx processes should be their own services

comments.body: I assume this implies that you will see the services starting and stopping when doing {{service eucanetd restart}}? This would be similar to how the eucaconsole handles restarting nginx and it works quite well.
Yes.  systemd allows multiple services to behave as a unit in that respect.
Lets take a look at this for 4.4 once EUCA-12725 is done. Move back to 5.0 target if problematic.

[~tsugawa] Should this be assigned to [~gholms] to merge since it is blocking EUCA-13000? Or does it need to be submitted to QA first?  [~sjones] are we ok with this now that EUCA-12725 is in QA? This issue doesn't have a clear next step in the comments.
[~lbiasi], the development work for EUCA-12725 was what my previous comment related to. That work is now done so no longer blocks this issue.
[~lbiasi], all eucanetd 4.4/5.0 related development is blocked until EUCA-12424 is merged.
eucanetd's selinux policy needs access to systemctl for these services for this patch to work.
[~gholms] What action needs to be taken by whom in order for this issue to be merged? It is Blocking work and I can't tell by the comments who needs to do what for the selinux policy.

[~tsugawa], [~lbiasi] I'm working on writing policy today and getting more errors than I expected to (making this work is not merely allowing systemctl access for the eucanetd process to run dhcpd, there are policy errors regarding file access (getattr) to things like eucanetd_getstats_net.out.)

I'll hopefully make some more progress on it throughout the rest of today and tomorrow but wanted to give you status.
[~mbacchi], do you have any new updates?

Verified with build from 1/28:

Both dhcpd and eucanetd are started at the same time:


{code:java}
[root@g-15-04 ~]# systemctl status eucanetd
‚óè eucanetd.service - Eucalyptus network daemon
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/eucanetd.service; enabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: inactive (dead) since Fri 2017-02-03 08:15:04 PST; 19s ago
  Process: 14701 ExecStart=/usr/sbin/eucanetd (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
 Main PID: 14702 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)

Jan 30 09:29:04 g-15-04.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com systemd[1]: Starting Eucalyptus network daemon...
Jan 30 09:29:04 g-15-04.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com systemd[1]: Started Eucalyptus network daemon.
Feb 03 08:15:04 g-15-04.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com systemd[1]: Stopping Eucalyptus network daemon...
Feb 03 08:15:04 g-15-04.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com systemd[1]: Stopped Eucalyptus network daemon.
[root@g-15-04 ~]# ps -ef | grep dhcpd
root      9636  9260  0 08:15 pts/0    00:00:00 grep --color=auto dhcpd
root     26669     1  0 Jan30 ?        00:00:05 /usr/sbin/dhcpd -f -cf /var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf br0
[root@g-15-04 ~]# systemctl start eucanetd

[root@g-15-04 ~]# ps -ef | grep euca
eucalyp+  9673     1  0 08:15 ?        00:00:00 /usr/sbin/eucanetd
root      9774     1  0 08:15 ?        00:00:00 /usr/sbin/dhcpd -f -cf /var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf br0

{code}
